intro: Serruria subcorymbosa, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract various pollinators. Serruria subcorymbosa is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and hardy nature.
